Articles.Content: Nope. I don't know what's with DropBox.
Whats wrong with the dropbox?!?
At this point in time, I'm uploading it to my Drive.
Is the dropbox done updating?
It hasn't really been working too well, but Google Drive is already making progress, compared to the Drop Box setup about an hour or two ago.

But, do yall need/want a tester?

How much % is google drive one at?

Sure, you can become a tester for this mod.

Well, collection of mods, because at this point in time it is too big to be just one planet pack, so I'm making it a collection of planet packs - for the sake of modularity.

Here's the Pack!

[AKPP-All](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwE8ZGIgrh9RUk5kODJJejlpSVE)

EDIT:

There are two textures for Kinern in the texture files, the one that is used is the more New color. However, there is a terrible Periwinkle line at the seam. But I think the rest of it looks pretty nice overall.

I hope the mod is going to be AWESOME!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-26T23:02:53Z" title="05/26/2016 11:02  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 26, 2016</time> by Kandjk**

How do I install I just put everything in gamedata folder into GameData? Or do I put the Individual planets files into GameData?

How do I install it? I really need help!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-26T22:29:47Z" title="05/26/2016 10:29  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 26, 2016</time> by Kandjk**

Sorry might have just been me.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-26T22:29:36Z" title="05/26/2016 10:29  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 26, 2016</time> by Kandjk**

Can you please help?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-26T22:29:24Z" title="05/26/2016 10:29  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 26, 2016</time> by Kandjk**
Sorry, just running errands. Place the individual files into the GameData folder (aka, open the GameData folder provided via the mod).
It doesn't load up the mod. COuld it be because the .cfg in a .cfg.txt?

That's strange, I swear it works on my side of things. Do you have any other mods installed?

EDIT: maybe it's a google thing. I'm away from my computer right now, but I'll try to find the issue when I'm back. Also, press Alt-F2 while the game loads and report anything that looks out of the ordinary.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-27T14:28:39Z" title="05/27/2016 02:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 27, 2016</time> by Astrofox**
Huzzah! Astro's Planet Pack is back!
Yeah. I've left Dropbox to sync overnight and so far no progress. Anyway, I am back.

Ok Dropbox is fixed!

[AKKP-All (Dropbox)](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/c6xknxx7nj5kpij/AADQ8Q74rFN0llY9Fgp73YnUa?dl=0)

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Astrofox said:
> 
> 
> Ok Dropbox is fixed!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [AKKP-All (Dropbox)](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/c6xknxx7nj5kpij/AADQ8Q74rFN0llY9Fgp73YnUa?dl=0)
> 

How'd you fix it?
restarting my PC. Although, I'm not sure about the pack in general.
The mod makes my Kerbal Space Program crash after loading a save. Can yall try to make it a little less resource intensive?
Okay... Maybe you should start taking a look at the individual packs instead of the whole thing. That may help. If not, well, I don't know what to do.

Ahhh I get it now ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") 

Oh, do yall use LoadOnDemand for Kopernicus so it will be less ram intensive?
Never heard of Load On Demand.
Might be mistaken then.
